intro: Phyllanthus bemangidiensis, commonly known as the Bemangidi sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is of interest in botanical research due to its potential medicinal properties and ecological adaptations.
